SEARCH
Package example.app.filedatabase

Class FileDatabase

java.lang.Object
example.app.filedatabase.FileDatabase
public final class FileDatabase extends Object

Class FileDatabase

This class is responsible for interacting with the file based database. The structure of the databases as follows:
  • Root: The top most directory for the file database, configured in database.config
  • Partition: Each root directory has sub directories, called partitions
  • Record File: Each partition has a file called record.ser where all the records for the resources are is stored. It uses TreeMap to store record in a sorted order
  • Data Directory: Each partition has a directory called data, which stores all the resources. Each resource is an individual file

      public FileDatabase()

  • Method Details

    • isRootPresent

      public static void isRootPresent() throws IOException, FileDatabaseConfigFileException
      This method is used to check if the root directory is present or not, specified by the database.config file.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the database.config could not be read
      NoSuchFileException - if the root directory is not present
      FileDatabaseConfigFileException - if the syntax in the database.config is wrong for the root directory path

    • isPartitionPresent

      public static void isPartitionPresent(String partitionName) throws FileDatabaseConfigFileException, IOException
      This method is used to check if the partition is present or not inside root directory.
      Parameters:
      partitionName - the name of the partition
      Throws:
      FileDatabaseConfigFileException - if the syntax in the database.config is wrong for root directory path
      NoSuchFileException - if the root or the partition directory is not present
      IOException - if the database.config could not be read

    • isRecordSerFilePresent

      public static void isRecordSerFilePresent(String partitionName) throws FileDatabaseConfigFileException, IOException
      This method is used to check if the record.ser file in a partition is present or not.
      Parameters:
      partitionName - the name of the partition that needs to be checked
      Throws:
      FileDatabaseConfigFileException - if the syntax in the database.config is wrong for root directory path
      NoSuchFileException - if the root or partition or record.ser partition is not present
      IOException - if the database.config could not be read

    • isDataDirPresent

      public static void isDataDirPresent(String partitionName) throws FileDatabaseConfigFileException, IOException
      This method is used to check if the data directory in a partition is present or not.
      Parameters:
      partitionName - the name of the partition that needs to be checked
      Throws:
      NoSuchFileException - if the root or partition or data directory is not present
      FileDatabaseConfigFileException - if the syntax in the database.config is wrong for root directory path
      IOException - if the database.config could not be read

    • createRoot

      public static void createRoot() throws FileDatabaseConfigFileException, IOException, CannotCreateFileException
      This method creates the root directory if it does not exist.
      Throws:
      FileDatabaseConfigFileException - if the syntax in the database.config is wrong
      IOException - if the database.config could not be read
      CannotCreateFileException - if the root directory could not be created

    • createPartition

      public static void createPartition(String partitionName) throws FileDatabaseConfigFileException, IOException, CannotCreateFileException
      This method creates a partition inside the root directory. It also invokes createRoot() method.
      Parameters:
      partitionName - the name of the partition
      Throws:
      FileDatabaseConfigFileException - if the syntax in the database.config is wrong
      IOException - if the database.config could not be read or if there are any errors creating the record.ser file
      CannotCreateFileException - if the partition directory or the data directory could not be created

    • addResource

      public static int addResource(String partitionName, Object keyForRecord, String uniqueId, Object resource) throws CannotCreateFileException, FileDatabaseConfigFileException, IOException, ClassNotFoundException, PartitionOverflowException
      This method adds an Object to a partition and updates the record.ser file. If the resource exists, it overwrites it.
      Parameters:
      partitionName - the name of the partition
      keyForRecord - the key to be added for the entry in the record.ser file for the given resource. This will be used for sorting.
      uniqueId - the value to be added for the key of the given resource in the record.ser file. This is the unique identifier of the resource. This is also the name of the file for the resource inside the data directory
      resource - the resource to be added
      Returns:
      the updated size of the partition
      Throws:
      CannotCreateFileException - if the partition directory or the data directory could not be created
      FileDatabaseConfigFileException - if the syntax in the database.config is wrong
      IOException - if the database.config or the record.ser could not be read or if there are any errors updating the record.ser file and creating resource file the data directory
      ClassNotFoundException - if the class is not found during deserialization of the record.ser file
      PartitionOverflowException - if the partition is already full

    • getResource

      public static Object getResource(String partitionName, Object uniqueId) throws CannotCreateFileException, FileDatabaseConfigFileException, IOException, ClassNotFoundException, FileDatabaseInternalException
      This method retrieves the resource from the file database.
      Parameters:
      partitionName - the name of the partition
      uniqueId - the unique identifier of the resource to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the resource object retrieved from the data directory or null in case it's not present
      Throws:
      CannotCreateFileException - If the partition directory or the data directory could not be created
      FileDatabaseConfigFileException - If the syntax in the database.config is wrong
      IOException - If the database.config could not be read or if there are any errors reading the resource or record.ser file
      ClassNotFoundException - If the class is not found during deserialization of the record.ser file
      FileDatabaseInternalException - If there's a mismatch between the record.ser file and the data directory entries

    • getIdsOfResources

      public static TreeSet<Object> getIdsOfResources(String partitionName) throws CannotCreateFileException, FileDatabaseConfigFileException, IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      This method retrieves the ids of all the resource from a partition.
      Parameters:
      partitionName - the name of the partition
      Returns:
      the resource object retrieved from the data directory or null in case it's not present
      Throws:
      CannotCreateFileException - If the partition directory or the data directory could not be created
      FileDatabaseConfigFileException - If the syntax in the database.config is wrong
      IOException - If the database.config could not be read or if there are any errors reading the record.ser file
      ClassNotFoundException - If the class is not found during deserialization of the record.ser file

    • removeResource

      public static void removeResource(String partitionName, String uniqueId) throws CannotCreateFileException, FileDatabaseConfigFileException, IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      This method adds an Object to a partition and updates the record.ser file. If the resource exists, it overwrites it.
      Parameters:
      partitionName - the name of the partition
      uniqueId - the unique value of the resource that's used to delete it from the database
      Throws:
      CannotCreateFileException - if the partition directory or the data directory could not be created
      FileDatabaseConfigFileException - if the syntax in the database.config is wrong
      IOException - if the database.config or the record.ser could not be read or if there are any errors updating the record.ser file
      ClassNotFoundException - if the class is not found during deserialization of the record.ser file

    • isResourcePresent

      public static boolean isResourcePresent(String partitionName, Object resource) throws FileDatabaseConfigFileException, IOException, CannotCreateFileException, FileDatabaseInternalException, ClassNotFoundException
      This method checks if a resource is present in the file database.
      Parameters:
      partitionName - the name of the partition
      resource - The resource to be matched
      Returns:
      true if the resource is present, false otherwise
      Throws:
      FileDatabaseConfigFileException - If the syntax in the database.config is wrong
      CannotCreateFileException - If the partition directory or the data directory could not be created
      IOException - If the database.config could not be read or if there are any errors reading the resource file
      ClassNotFoundException - If the class is not found during deserialization of the record.ser file
      FileDatabaseInternalException - If there's a mismatch between the record.ser file and the data directory entries

    • removePartition

      public static void removePartition(String partitionName) throws FileDatabaseConfigFileException, IOException
      This method takes deletes a partition.
      Parameters:
      partitionName - the name of the partition to be deleted
      Throws:
      FileDatabaseConfigFileException - If the syntax in the database.config is wrong
      IOException - If the database.config could not be read
